headline: Fed won't cut rates again until a new chair takes over: Economist
summary: Federal Reserve officials have voted to cut interest rates by 25 basis points at their December FOMC meeting on Wednesday, lowering rates to a range of 3.5 to 3.75%. This marks the third and final rate cut of 2025. Central bank officials are currently signaling only one rate cut to come in 2026. Nomura Chief Economist David Seif comes on Market Domination to discuss the latest rate decision, why he believes this could be the last rate cut until the end of Jerome Powell's term in May 2026. Check out Yahoo Finance's Jennifer Schonberger profile each of the five shortlist candidates that President Trump could nominate: frontrunner Kevin Hassett, former Fed Governor Kevin Warsh, current Fed Governor Chris Waller, Fed Vice Chair of Supervision Michelle Bowman, and BlackRock's (BLK) head of fixed income Rick Rieder. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Fed's Powell can no longer 'corral the ranks' of dissenting votes
summary: Federal Reserve officials are expected to cut interest rates at their December FOMC meeting on Wednesday, which will be followed by a press conference with Fed Chair Jerome Powell. QI Research CEO and Chief Strategist Danielle DiMartino Booth comes on Morning Brief to lay out which FOMC members are anticipated to dissent on dovish and hawkish monetary policy. She is the former advisor to former Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas President Richard Fisher. Also check out Yahoo Finance's Jennifer Schonberger profile each of the five shortlist candidates that President Trump could nominate as the next Fed chair after Powell's term ends in May 2026: frontrunner Kevin Hassett, former Fed Governor Kevin Warsh, current Fed Governor Chris Waller, Fed Vice Chair of Supervision Michelle Bowman, and BlackRock's (BLK) head of fixed income Rick Rieder. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Fed expected to cut rates, then ease up in 2026. Here's why.
summary: Federal Reserve officials are expected to cut interest rates at their December FOMC meeting on Wednesday, which will be followed by a press conference with Fed Chair Jerome Powell. Yahoo Finance senior Fed reporter Jennifer Schonberger comments on Wall Street's anticipation for a hawkish rate cut and the division on voting Fed members over the progress in reaching their inflation rate target. President Trump is also reported to have started the interview process for the next Fed chair. Also check out Yahoo Finance's Jennifer Schonberger profile each of the five shortlist candidates that President Trump could nominate as the next Fed chair after Powell's term ends in May 2026: frontrunner Kevin Hassett, former Fed Governor Kevin Warsh, current Fed Governor Chris Waller, Fed Vice Chair of Supervision Michelle Bowman, and BlackRock's (BLK) head of fixed income Rick Rieder. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: BlackRock Expands Liquid Alternatives Offering with Multi-Strategy Active ETF
summary: NEW YORK, December 10, 2025--Today, BlackRock bolstered its liquid alternative platform with the launch of the iShares Systematic Alternatives Active ETF (Nasdaq:IALT), a multi-strategy alternative fund designed to deliver differentiated sources of return across market cycles through the transparency and convenience of an ETF. BlackRock is the largest provider of liquid alternative strategies in the U.S., capturing over 50% of inflows year-to-date.1

BlackRock is the largest provider of liquid alternative strategies in the U.S., capturing over 50% of inflows year-to-date.1

headline: Will BlackRock's (BLK) Staked Ethereum ETF Bid Redefine Its Crypto Innovation and Fee Narrative?
summary: Earlier this month, BlackRock moved further into digital assets by filing with the SEC for an iShares staked Ethereum ETF that pairs ether price exposure with on-chain staking rewards, using a multi-custodian structure anchored by Coinbase and BNY Mellon. The filing signals BlackRock’s push to broaden yield-focused crypto offerings at a time when investors are reassessing Bitcoin ETF allocations and looking for income-oriented alternatives. We’ll now examine how this push into staked...

headline: Bond market looking forward to 'appropriate' rate cut by the Fed
summary: Investors are forecasting Federal Reserve officials to vote to cut interest rates at the conclusion of their December FOMC meeting on Wednesday, followed by a press conference with Chair Jerome Powell. GammaRoad Capital Partners CIO Jordan Rizzuto comes on Market Domination to further discuss his expectations. Catch Jordan Rizzuto talk about how long-term bond holders will be watching the Fed's next rate decision and leadership change in 2026. Also check out Yahoo Finance's Jennifer Schonberger profile each of the five shortlist candidates that President Trump could nominate as the next Fed chair after Powell's term ends in May 2026: frontrunner Kevin Hassett, former Fed Governor Kevin Warsh, current Fed Governor Chris Waller, Fed Vice Chair of Supervision Michelle Bowman, and BlackRock's (BLK) head of fixed income Rick Rieder. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: What Today's Fed Decision May Mean for Equities
summary: BlackRock's Helen Jewell discusses how significant today's Federal Reserve's decision is for equity markets. "We'd originally priced in quite a few cuts kind of through the end of the year and into next year," she tells Bloomberg Television. "If that starts to stabilize a little bit, then, of course, from an equities perspective, this incredible rise in equities we've seen this year might see a little bit of a pause."

headline: Caledonia Mining Corporation Plc: Notification of relevant change to significant shareholder
summary: ST HELIER, Jersey, Dec. 10, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Caledonia Mining Corporation Plc (NYSE AMERICAN: CMCL; AIM: CMCL; VFEX: CMCL) ("Caledonia" or "the Company") announces that it received notification on December 9, 2025 from BlackRock, Inc. that on December 8, 2025 it had crossed a threshold for notification of a relevant change (as defined by the AIM Rules for Companies). A copy of the notification is below. Enquiries: Caledonia Mining Corporation PlcMark LearmonthCamilla HorsfallTel: +44 153

headline: Great Income Squeeze Begins as Fed Spells End to Easy Yields
summary: In recent years, investors were paid handsomely to play it safe.  Short-term US Treasuries offered yields above 5% — a rare chance to earn solid returns without locking up capital or chasing risk.  For pensions, insurers and endowments, it marked a decisive break from the post-crisis decade of near-zero interest rates.
